main event: Multiple radar returns and visual sightings by military personnel of unidentified flying objects over Anchorage, Alaska during July 1952.
interesting points: Various radar observers and pilots from the 66th Fighter-Interceptor Squadron reported unusual radar returns on three occasions that could not be identified as known aircraft., On July 5, 1952, initial radar contact with an unidentified object was made at 20,000 yards, which climbed rapidly but was lost from sight., On July 21, 1952, a radar contact at 21,000 yards was established that disappeared before visual contact was made., The radar observers noted that at no time was visual contact established, suggesting high speeds and unusual maneuverability of the objects., Reports indicate that radar malfunctions were unlikely given multiple independent observations of similar radar contacts.
